instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3787 with all new FDMF6708Ns, still shutting down randomly. any ideas?
threads.message:
Have this 3787 in that i'm a bit out of ideas for.
It is doing the random shutdowns, often times losing video (but backlight stays on) and staying on like that for a little while before shutting down.
I have replaced all FDMF6808's with 6708N i ordered from digikey (so no sanded down ali-shite)
After testing it at first seemed to be stable, but just now after 4 hours of no shutdowns, it started doing the same thing..

Anyone have any new ideas for this one? It looks similar to the 3332-U8900 symptoms: black screen and then shutdown, but i think the U8900 is not often the issue on these boards, is it?
I don't like no-fixes so i thought i'd check with you guys first before giving up

threads.title: 820-3787 with all new FDMF6708Ns, still shutting down randomly. any ideas?
threads.message:
Use gfxcardstatus to disable dedicated GPU.
Then check if has same problem runing hours on iGPU only...

threads.title: 820-3787 with all new FDMF6708Ns, still shutting down randomly. any ideas?
threads.message: Yeah prob garbage at that point.

threads.title: 820-3787 with all new FDMF6708Ns, still shutting down randomly. any ideas?
threads.message:
what i thought indeed..
I tested it with gfxcardstatus and no intermittent shutdowns anymore on the integrated GPU.
Thanks for the tip!
